title: Israel’s ultra-Orthodox, exempt from military service, now enlisting
description: Two thousand Haredim have applied, sometimes quietly, to avoid drawing attention, to serve in the Israeli Defense Forces.

title: Overcrowded Rafah, already short on food, braces for new waves of displaced
description: There is little relief in sight. Talks in Cairo, and an Egyptian cease-fire proposal, appear to be in early stages, and Hamas officials say they will not return hostages until the fighting stops.

title: Hong Kong activist convicted under security law flees to U.K.
description: Tony Chung, the youngest person sentenced under the Hong Kong national security law, fled to the United Kingdom this week and intends to seek asylum there.

title: Ukraine gets modest U.S. weapons package, until Congress can agree to more
description: The $250 million package addresses some battlefield shortfalls but still leaves Ukraine facing an uncertain future without critical support entering the new year.

title: Israel-Gaza war live updates: Hungry civilians overwhelm aid convoys, WHO says; conflict spreads to central camps
description: Heavy bombardment and fighting continued across the Strip, the U.N. humanitarian office said, after the IDF announced expanded operations in refugee camps.

title: An aspiring journalist documented Gaza’s beauty, then its destruction
description: Young Palestinian journalists like Plestia Alaqad, Motaz Azaiza and Hind Khoudary became a window into the carnage in Gaza. This is Plestia’s story.

title: Russia’s military wives emerge as wild card to Putin’s triumphal mood
description: The Kremlin has rebuffed their pleas, but the wives and mothers of soldiers have emerged as one of the few sour notes in President Vladimir Putin’s stage-managed reelection.

title: With funds running out, U.S. sends more weapons to Ukraine
description: The provision of $250 million in military aid comes as President Biden struggles to win over congressional skeptics opposed to sending Ukraine more aid.
